intro: Acmispon argophyllus var. fremontii, commonly known as the Fremont prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features spiny stems and leaves, with yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The Fremont prickly poppy is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
